intro: Iodanthus hesperidoides, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Iodanthus hesperidoides is often found in rocky areas and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for xeriscaping.
